newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY UNION-CATT NAMED AS RESERVE FOR BRITISH LIONS.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-CATT NAMED AS RESERVE FOR BRITISH LIONS.

text.p: England fly-half Mike Catt is put straight on the bench for the British Lions' fifth tour match against Northern Transvaal on Saturday.
The South African born Catt arrived in the country on Wednesday and gets an immediate chance to impress after scoring 25 points in England's 46-20 win over Argentina on Saturday.

Tony Underwood, who scored two tries in the midweek 64-14 demolition of Mpumalanga, plays his second match of the week in a side otherwise largely the one who won 38-21 over Western Province last Saturday.
Tour skipper Martin Johnson plays his second match as part of an all-English front five.
Ireland number eight Eric Miller is tried at openside flanker with Scott Quinnell locking the base of the scrum.
England's Jeremy Guscott and Scotland's Allan Tait are again paired in the centres.
Welsh centre Scott Gibbs, who damaged ankle ligaments in the second match of the tour, returns to action with a place alongside Catt on the bench.
The Lions have won all four matches of their South African tour to date.

British Lions - 15-Tim Stimpson; 14-John Bentley, 13-Jeremy Guscott, 12-Allan Tait, 11-Tony Underwood; 10-Gregor Townsend, 9-Rob Howley; 8-Scott Quinnell, 7-Eric Miller, 6-Lawrence Dallaglio, 5-Simon Shaw, 4-Martin Johnson, 3-Jason Leonard, 2-Mark Regn, 1-Graham Rowntree.
